result.execSummary:
The defendant James William Beaudry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James William Beaudry is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James William Beaudry was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • James William Beaudry was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.

No further violations of the law.
No violent contact with Nicole B.
No contact with Antonio B. and Carrie P. unless approved by agent.

Complete a Cognitive Behavior Program.
Complete a course in anger management.
Attend parenting classes.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent, with credit for 18 days time served.

records.addlTxt:
15A 038014

Applied in error. Reference payable # 15A 038081.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 3:  On motion of the state, Court ordered charges dismissed.
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 4 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made by Nicole B.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 2 1/2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 18 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 18 MONTHS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete a Cognitive Behavior Program.
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No violent contact with Nicole B.
- No contact with Antonio B. and Carrie P. unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.
.
AS TO COUNT 4:  Court sentenced the defendant to 90 days in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 18 days time served.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Felony Bail Jumping, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.49(1)(b), a Class H Felony.
*
AS TO COUNT 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Penalty Enhancer, Repeater, dismissed.
